title: Create site navigation and header component
description:
Create site navigation header component with museum label aesthetic:

Navigation Position: Static with Smart Hide/Show
- Initially static header that hides on scroll down, reveals on scroll up
- Economy of motion: only appears when needed
- Compression/release rhythm: hidden = focus on content, revealed = navigation
- Threshold: hide after scrolling down past 100px
- Smooth cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1) transition (300ms)

Desktop Navigation:
- Minimal header with logo/name on left
- Nav links: Build, Stills, Studio (museum label typography)
- Horizontal layout with 3rem gap between links
- Display font, 0.875rem, uppercase, letter-spacing 0.05em
- Subtle hover states: accent color change + underline animation
- Underline transforms from right to left (scaleX transform)
- Paper background with hairline bottom border (stone/20% opacity)

Mobile Navigation: Architectural Slide Panel from Right
- Hamburger icon: minimal three horizontal lines (24px wide, 2px height, 6px gap)
- Panel slides in from right edge (80% screen width, max 320px)
- Bone background with subtle shadow
- Close button: signal red × in top-right (44px touch target)
- Menu items: vertical stack with 2rem gap, museum label typography (1.25rem)
- Active item: accent color left border (3px, scaleY animation)
- Each item 44px minimum touch target
- Dimmed overlay (40% opacity ink) on visible content sliver (20%)
- Tap overlay to close menu
- Smooth 300ms slide animation

Accessibility:
- Semantic <nav> element
- ARIA labels for hamburger ('Menu') and close button ('Close menu')
- Keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Esc to close menu)
- Focus trapping in mobile menu when open
- Current page indicator (.active class)
- Focus visible states with accent color outline

Implementation:
- Create templates/components/navigation.html.twig
- Stimulus controller for mobile menu: assets/controllers/mobile-menu_controller.js
- Stimulus controller for scroll behavior: assets/controllers/nav-scroll_controller.js
- Integrate into base.html.twig layout
- Per-page accent color via CSS variable (inherit from body class)

Dependencies: None (foundational - should be done first)
Priority: P1

title: Implement photo download functionality with access control
description:
Implement photo download functionality with access control:

Access Rules:
- Public collections: Downloads DISABLED by default (protect original images from reuse)
- Password-protected collections: Downloads ENABLED with NO rate limits (for sharing with friends)
- Collection.allowDownloads boolean controls this per collection
- Only authenticated users can download from password-protected collections

Features:
- Download original photo button (museum label 'Download Original' with file size)
- Only visible if: collection.allowDownloads == true AND (collection is public OR user authenticated to collection)
- Proper Content-Disposition headers for browser download
- Original filename preserved in download
- Access control checks before serving file
- NO rate limiting needed (trusted friends only have access)

Mobile Considerations:
- Show file size in museum label format (e.g., 'Download Original • 18.3 MB')
- Optional: Offer optimized web version for mobile data (photo_lg filter ~2MB vs original ~20MB)
- Clear, restrained messaging about file sizes

UI Placement:
- Button in film peel pulled-out view (bottom corner)
- Also in EXIF flip view as secondary action
- Disabled state with tooltip if downloads not allowed for collection

Route: /stills/albums/{slug}/photos/{id}/download

Dependencies: samwilkinson-9ne (film peel view shows download button), samwilkinson-au8 (password auth)

title: Build /stills bookshelf view with CSS 3D transforms
description:
Build /stills bookshelf view with CSS 3D transforms:

Desktop View:
- 3D bookshelf with book spines representing photo collections
- Each spine unique color/texture from accent palette (signal/teal/mustard/persimmon)
- Aging effect: sepia filter + noise overlay (scales with collection.startDate)
- One color family per shelf (restrained, curated)
- Pull-out animation on click (restrained perspective, ~15deg rotateY)
- Hover: slight lift and shadow increase
- Museum labels on spine (collection name, location, year)

Mobile View:
- UX pattern TBD - pending awwwards.com research for inspiration
- Options to consider:
  * Vertical stack of book spines (simplified 2D)
  * Horizontal scroll carousel of books
  * Grid of book covers (bird's eye view)
  * Hybrid: simplified 3D with touch-drag rotation
- Prioritize clarity and touch-friendliness over 3D complexity on mobile
- Ensure book titles remain legible at mobile sizes

Visual Style per Collection:
- Spine color from collection.visualStyle.spineColor (JSON field)
- Texture overlay (linen, leather, cloth) from collection.visualStyle.texture
- Aging intensity calculated from collection.startDate (older = more sepia/wear)
- Randomized aging patterns using collection.visualStyle.agingSeed

Password-Protected Collections:
- Show book on shelf with lock icon on spine
- Click triggers password modal (samwilkinson-au8)
- Spine slightly dimmed/desaturated to indicate restricted access

Accessibility:
- Respect prefers-reduced-motion (show 2D grid instead of 3D)
- Keyboard navigation (Tab through books, Enter to open)
- ARIA labels for each collection
- Screen reader: 'Collection: Japan 2024, 42 photos, click to view'

Route: /stills
Controller: StillsController::index

Dependencies: samwilkinson-a3g (controller), samwilkinson-au8 (password modal)

title: Build /studio posts index with workspace aesthetic
description: Create blog/posts listing page with workspace/studio vibe. Show post cards in chronological order with publish dates, reading time estimates, and excerpt. Apply warm minimalist design with paper/bone backgrounds.

comments.author: sam
comments.text: NEW DIRECTION: Three.js scattered papers on ground (inspired by shopify.supply). Each paper represents a post - when you look closely at a paper you can read the post title/metadata. Interactive 3D scene with camera controls. Pieces of paper scattered on floor/ground surface. Should feel like walking into a writer's studio with papers everywhere.

title: Build photo film peel Stimulus controller with EXIF viewer
description:
Build photo film peel Stimulus controller with EXIF viewer:

Visual Effects:
- Acetate texture overlay on photos
- Hover: rotateX() peel effect (subtle angle, snappy easing)
- Click: 'pull out' photo (scale 1.05, elevated z-index, dim background)
- Flip animation to reveal EXIF data on back of photo
- Keyboard navigation: arrow keys (prev/next), Esc (close), Space (flip)
- Focus trapping when photo is pulled out

EXIF Display (back of photo):
- Museum label styling for metadata
- Show: Camera, Lens, ISO, Shutter Speed, Aperture, Focal Length, Date Taken
- Monospace tabular numerals for values
- Hairline dividers between fields
- Warm bone background matching design system

Mobile Adaptations:
- Skip hover state, use tap to pull out
- Swipe gestures for prev/next photos
- Pinch-to-zoom: Use browser default zoom behavior (sufficient for most cases)
  * Alternative: Implement custom pinch-to-zoom if browser default feels awkward (test first)
- Tap back of photo to flip to EXIF
- Double-tap to zoom in/out (standard mobile pattern)

Accessibility:
- Respect prefers-reduced-motion (disable 3D transforms, use fade transitions)
- Screen reader announcements for photo navigation
- Proper ARIA labels ('Photo X of Y', 'Press Space to flip to EXIF data')
- Focus visible states on interactive elements

Store in assets/controllers/film-peel_controller.js

Dependencies: samwilkinson-jg2 (album view uses this controller)

title: Generate subtle noise texture SVG for surface treatments
description:
Create noise.svg for adding texture to backgrounds and surfaces:

- Generate or source subtle noise/grain texture as SVG
- Monochrome (grayscale) for versatility
- Low opacity (5-10%) for subtlety
- Tileable pattern (seamless repeat)
- Optimize SVG size (<10KB)

Apply to:

- Object cards (very subtle, 3% opacity)

CSS updates in app.css:

Test on multiple backgrounds to ensure visibility is subtle but present

title: Implement password authentication for restricted photo collections
description:
Build session-based authentication for password-protected collections:

Features:
- Password verification form with museum aesthetic (minimal, clean input, signal red accent on submit)
- Session-based auth with 7-day expiry (configurable via COLLECTION_AUTH_TTL env var)
- Access control: public collections visible to all, restricted require password
- Middleware/listener to check authentication before showing collection photos
- Store unlocked collection IDs in session
- Mobile-friendly password input with proper keyboard hints
- Error states with clear, restrained messaging
- 'Forgot password' message directs to contact (no recovery flow needed)

UI placement: Modal overlay when clicking restricted collection book spine on bookshelf

Dependencies: samwilkinson-7xu (bookshelf view triggers password prompt)

title: Build Twig component macros for reusable design elements

title: Build flipbook intro animation for homepage
description:
Build hero 'crank viewer' flipbook animation for homepage:

Content: Animated 'intro to me' showing software development, photography, and personal identity
- Flashing terminal with code
- Animated version of Sam (illustration/silhouette)
- Photography scenes (camera, taking pictures)
- Old school Mac (Lisa) with vintage Apple aesthetic
- Architectural elements (Frank Lloyd Wright influence)
- Zoom in/out transitions between scenes
- Interesting animated transitions matching modernist aesthetic

Behavior:
- Autoplays once on page load as main focal element
- Frame-by-frame sprite animation (like vintage film viewer)
- When animation completes: shrinks slightly to make room for other homepage sections (object cards)
- Users can click to re-open and manually scrub through sequence using crank interaction
- Crank metaphor: circular handle user drags to advance/rewind frames

Technical Implementation:
- Stimulus controller for crank interaction
- Sprite sheet or individual frames (60-120 frames recommended for smooth transitions)
- Canvas or CSS sprite animation
- Smooth frame interpolation based on crank rotation angle
- Autoplay on mount, then shrink with smooth transition
- Click to expand back to hero size
- Progressive enhancement (show static poster frame if JS disabled)

Mobile Adaptations:
- Crank interaction TBD (drag might be flakey - consider swipe, timeline scrubber, or auto-play only)
- Consider reducing frame count on mobile for performance (30-60 frames)
- Ensure touch targets are large enough (44px minimum)
- Test various UX patterns for scrubbing (horizontal slider, circular drag, prev/next buttons)

Visual Design:
- Cube-shaped flipbook machine with vintage aesthetic
- Crank handle on right side (rotates when user drags or auto-playing)
- Frame viewport in center of cube (animation displays here)
- Warm materials: walnut wood texture, cognac leather accents, bone/putty borders
- Museum label at bottom: 'Drag Crank to Explore' (or 'Auto-Playing' during intro)
- Signal red accent on crank handle
- CSS 3D transforms for cube depth and crank rotation
- Shrunk state: corner position with subtle pulse/glow to indicate interactivity
- Match modernist aesthetic with restrained animation easing

Animation Production:
- Create storyboard with key scenes
- Export as sprite sheet or individual PNG sequence
- Optimize for web (WebP format, compressed)
- Target ~2-3MB total file size

Dependencies: None (optional enhancement, can be added after v1)
Priority: P3 (optional feature)

Design Details:
- Match homepage spacing and rhythm
- Use existing design system colors
- Generous negative space
- One punch accent color (signal red)

Test with sample markdown content in both Studio posts and Build case studies

title: Implement Three.js scattered papers scene for Studio index
description:
Build interactive 3D scene using Three.js for /studio index page. Requirements:
- Ground/floor plane with scattered paper objects
- Each paper shows real post data (title, date, excerpt) on close inspection
- Camera controls (orbit/pan) similar to shopify.supply
- Papers should have realistic physics/placement
- Responsive and performant
- Fallback for browsers without WebGL
- Click/hover states for papers to navigate to posts
- Warm lighting to match site aesthetic
- Paper textures with subtle wear/aging
- Mobile-friendly version (simplified or 2D fallback)

Technical stack:
- Three.js for 3D rendering
- Potentially react-three-fiber if using React, or vanilla Three.js
- GLSL shaders for paper materials
- OrbitControls or similar for camera

Reference: https://shopify.supply/

comments.author: sam
comments.text:
APPROVED DESIGN DIRECTION:
- Isometric/angled camera view (30-35° angle) looking down at desk surface
- Papers scattered on warm surface (matches MCM/Eames 'objects in space' philosophy)
- Integrates as horizontal section (~60-70vh) within page, NOT fullscreen takeover
- Subtle fan effect that gently blows papers (restrained, not chaotic)
- Hover: paper lifts ~20px and tilts toward camera (like Shopify clothing wave)
- Click: paper comes forward, can rotate to inspect, then navigate to post
- Ambient animations: gentle breathing/floating when idle
- Scroll parallax: depth-based movement as you scroll past
- Warm lighting to match site aesthetic
- Orthographic camera for performance
- Must feel native to site, not like typical Three.js demo
